intro: Callisia saxicola, commonly known as the rock ctenanthe, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are borne on slender, erect spikes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found growing on rocky surfaces or in dry, sunny environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses.
